name: Lentil Curry
description: Creamy red lentil curry with Indian spices. Vegan, protein-rich, and incredibly flavorful.

instructions.instruction: Rinse lentils thoroughly under running water until water runs clear.
Heat olive oil in large, deep pot over medium heat.
Add onion and saut√© 5 minutes until soft and lightly golden.
instructions.tip: Well-cooked onions form the base of curry flavor.

instructions.instruction: Add garlic and ginger, cook 1 minute until fragrant.
instructions.tip: Don't burn garlic - it becomes bitter.

instructions.instruction: Add all spices (curry, cumin, turmeric, garam masala, pepper flakes).
Stir and cook 30-60 seconds until spices are fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes and cook 2-3 minutes until bubbling.
Add rinsed lentils and stir to combine.
Add vegetable broth and coconut milk. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer 25-30 minutes until lentils are soft and curry thickens.
Add salt and taste. Adjust spices as needed.
If using, add spinach and stir 2 minutes until wilted.
Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle fresh cilantro and serve.

tips: Also known as daal - foundation of Indian cuisine.
Coconut milk adds creaminess and subtle sweetness.
Lentils are plant-based protein and iron source.
Tastes even better next day - flavors develop.
Freezes well for 3 months - perfect for meal prep.
storageInfo: Refrigerate 5 days, freeze 3 months. Add water when reheating.
servingSuggestion: Serve over basmati rice, with naan bread or chapati. Dollop yogurt on top.
variations: Spinach version: Add 3 handfuls spinach - Palak Daal.
Green lentils: More earthy flavor, 10 minutes extra cooking.
With tadka: Top with butter-fried cumin and chili.
Protein boost: Add chicken or shrimp.
